page.title: 02SCHOOL CLOSURES-EAST READING
page.content: Two Secondary schools on the Wokingham Rd are closing. The closure decision was finally made in 1983/4. They are closing (July 1986), due to lack of pupils in Reading. There used to be around 1000 pupils in each and they are now down to 200 each. In the last year of school the numbers will drop to 70-80 pupils in each. The schools belong to the Council. Reading College of Technology wish to take over the buildings. The equipment will be sent to other schools, some will be taken by teachers to use in their new schools. Many teachers will stay until 1986. The children will be transferred to other schools at 4th form and 6th form levels. The council will pay a grant to the pupils for school uniforms. Those who live far away will be given free bus passes.
